intro: Minuartia vestita, commonly known as the white sand pink, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of foliage. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are usually pink or white in color, often with five petals. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Minuartia vestita is adapted to arid environments and is known for its resilience in harsh conditions.
